text: Samsung Galaxy S21 is a series of Android-based smartphones designed, developed, marketed, and made by Samsung Electronics as part of its Galaxy S series. They are after the Galaxy S20 series. The first three were announced at Samsung's Galaxy Unpacked event on 14 January 2021 while the FE was annouced on 3 January 2022. The first three phones were started on 29 January 2021 while the FE was started on 11 January 2022. == Design == Samsung Galaxy S21's design is similar to the one before, Samsung Galaxy S20. The rear cameras have been made part of the phone body; the S21 Ultra has carbon fiber for special colors. The S21 FE offers 6 GB and 8 GB of RAM with 128 GB and 256 GB options for internal storage. All four models lack a microSD card slot, which was present on the S20 series. == Reviews == Techradar wrote about the S21: "The Galaxy S21 isn’t the star of Samsung’s S series in 2021, like we’ve been used to for most of the past decade, but it’s a solid smartphone choice with an impressive camera, powerful internals and great battery life. If you want the best of the best, look to the Galaxy S21 Ultra; but if you want a handset that’s cheaper than the Galaxy S20 was at launch, with a whole load of premium features, the Galaxy S21 is a delight to use, and will do you proud." == References == Category:Mobile phones with multiple rear cameras Category:Mobile phones with 4K video recording Category:Samsung Galaxy Category:Mobile phones introduced in 2021
